Argentina: Luis Vernet establishes settlement on the Falkland Islands
Armenia: Treaty of Turkmanchay. Eastern Armenia is forcefully ceded by Persia to Russia per the Russo-Persian War (1826-1828), strengthening Russian control of Transcaucasus.
Brazil:
Treaty of Commerce and Navigation signed between Brazil and Denmark, establishing diplomatic relations between the two countries.
Irish and German Mercenary Soldiers' revolt rebellion breaks out.
Dom Pedro I is married by proxy to Amélie of Leuchtenberg.
Treaty of Montevideo: Brazil and Argentina recognize the independence of Uruguay.
Chile: Francisco Antonio Pinto assumes power after the resignation of Encalada and his predecessors. Chilean Constitution of 1828.
Colombia: After the failure of the constitutional convention of Ocaña Simón Bolívar proclaimed himself dictator, through the "Organic Decree of Dictatorship".
India: Rani of Jhansi Laxmi bai was born (to 1858)
Philippine: Earthquake strikes Manila destroying many of its buildings
Russia: Russo-Persian War (1826–1828) Facing the possibility of a Russian conquest of Tehran, Persia signed the Treaty of Turkmenchay. The Russian army occupied Wallachia. Russo-Turkish War (1828–1829): The Russian armed forces crossed into Dobruja, an Ottoman territory.
